data.scheme_name: New Industrial Policy 2020-25-Investment Promotion Subsidy for Medium Enterprises-For General Category (Male Entrepreneurs)-Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides benefits upto 35% of Value of fixed assets (VFA) for a maximum period 5 years to attract investment and generate employment.
data.eligibility:
1. Minimum direct Employment 20 Number for first INR 10 crore and additional 7 employment for every additional investment of INR 10 crore proportionately.
  2. Units in Manufacturing and Manufacturing-related service industries.
  3. Incentive will be provided only to the new investments.
data.conditions:
1. Eligible MSMEs shall commence commercial production within 3 years from the date of approval from the District Level Single Window Clearance Committee (DLSWCC) / State Level Single Window Clearance Committee (SLSWCC). Note- If any enterprise who has not taken approval from the DLSWCC / SLSWCC for their project for any reason shall commence commercial production within 3 years from the date of taking possession of land / building or taking building plan approval.
  2. The eligible enterprise shall not carry out any trading activity or provision of any services not relating to eligible products from its place of business. The eligible unit shall have to obtain a separate registration, if the unit carries out trading activity or provision of any services not relating to eligible products. If carried out, this turnover will not be eligible for availing Investment promotion subsidy. Resale of products / goods by the eligible unit will not be considered for turnover incentives.
data.beneficiaries:
1. Minimum direct Employment 20 Number for first INR 10 crore and additional 7 employment for every additional investment of INR 10 crore proportionately.
  2. Units in Manufacturing and Manufacturing-related service industries.
  3. Incentive will be provided only to the new investments.
    • Breweries & Distilleries of all types excluding winery & ethanol plant established as integral part of sugar industry.
    • Khandasari and Jaggery making enterprises.
    • Photo Studios & Colour Processing and instant photo printing Enterprises.
    • Photo Copying / Xerox Machines / Fax Machines / Data Entry / Data Recovery enterprises.
    • Fertilizer mixing units.
    • All types of Saw Mills excluding manufacture of particle board / Low Density Fiber Board (LDF)/Medium Density FiberBoards(MDF)/High Density Fiber Boards(HDF).
    • Beedis / Cigarettes / Cigars / Gutka & Tobacco based products manufacturing enterprises.
    • Azoic / Reactive Dyes manufacturing enterprises.
    • Fire Cracker manufacturing enterprises.
    • Industries manufacturing Ozone depleting substances.
    • Laundries including Power Laundries.
    • Brick making Enterprises excluding Cement Hollow / Solid Blocks, Wire Cut, Fly Ash Bricks and Refractory Bricks.
    • Poultry including hatcheries.
    • Popcorn and Ice candy making Enterprises excluding Ice Cream Manufacturing.
    • Coffee roasting and grinding units having installed capacity of less than 2MT a day.
    • Clock and Watch / Mobile / Computer and Hardware equipment repair enterprises.
    • Cassette recording [Audio & Video] enterprises.
    • Cyanide Manufacturing enterprises.
    • Mining and Mining Equipment.
    • Lime kiln / burnt lime units.
    • X-ray clinics and clinical / pathological laboratories and scanning, MRI testing enterprises.
    • All industries of mobile nature like rigs, concrete / tar mixing plants / hot-mix plants including site oriented plants / industries.
    • Units engaged in manufacture of Chrysolite Asbestos (White Crystal).
    • All types of Saloon / Spas / Massage Centres, etc.
    • All types of hotels / restaurants / resorts / amusement parks, etc.
    • Vermi compost
    • Roof top solar power generation.
    • Bottling of LPG and other gases.
    • Aggregators/ supply chain business Enterprises related to / supporting bio-fuel manufacturing units *Considering the contribution to environment, eligible subsidy will be extended to new investments made on establishing of ETPs.
data.prerequisites:
1. Eligible MSMEs shall commence commercial production within 3 years from the date of approval from the District Level Single Window Clearance Committee (DLSWCC) / State Level Single Window Clearance Committee (SLSWCC). Note- If any enterprise who has not taken approval from the DLSWCC / SLSWCC for their project for any reason shall commence commercial production within 3 years from the date of taking possession of land / building or taking building plan approval.
  2. The eligible enterprise shall not carry out any trading activity or provision of any services not relating to eligible products from its place of business. The eligible unit shall have to obtain a separate registration, if the unit carries out trading activity or provision of any services not relating to eligible products. If carried out, this turnover will not be eligible for availing Investment promotion subsidy. Resale of products / goods by the eligible unit will not be considered for turnover incentives.
  3. Eligible Medium Enterprise shall submit application for sanction of Investment Promotion subsidy within one year from the date of commencement of commercial production.
  4. If the eligible enterprise is already manufacturing the same product in one or more existing industrial enterprise in Karnataka, then the turnover of all such existing industrial enterprises of the same products for five consecutive years commencing from the year from which the industrial undertaking avails incentives under this policy shall not be lower than the average turnover of the same product in the immediately preceding three financial year from the year the industrial undertaking avails incentives under this policy.
  5. Digital Signature is made Mandatory for Applying online Applications to Karnataka Udyog Mitra.
  6. All Medium Enterprise who have- Udyam /Industrial Entrepreneur Memorandum (IEM)/Industrial License (IL) Registration Certificate.
  7. Enterprises can avail incentives and concessions under any one policy of the State. i.e., Enterprises availing incentives and concessions under Industrial Policy 2020-2025 will not have a choice to avail partly in the Industrial Policy 2020-2025 and partly in any other Policy of the State in vogue and vice-versa, unless otherwise specified by the Government.
  8. Eligible enterprise shall have to obtain a separate registration under GST Act for manufacturing of eligible products only & only this turnover will be considered for Investment promotion subsidy
data.nodal_agency: State Level Co-ordination Committee (SLCC), Government of Karnataka
data.context: Government is pleased to announce the New Industrial Policy 2020-25, to build on the strengths of Karnataka industry and to enable it to fulfill its role as the engine of growth and to shoulder responsibility of adding more hi-tech value and employment. The new industrial revolution presents new opportunities for industry, particularly manufacturing and manufacturing-related service industries. These developments are enabling smart manufacturing, customization, collaborative production and other new production modes and business models.
data.objective: The aim is to attract INR 5 Lakh crore in investments, create 20 lakh jobs, achieve 3rd position in merchandise exports, maintain a 10% industrial growth rate, and foster an ecosystem for technology adoption and innovation.
data.description:
1. Investment Subsidy-Zone 1- 2.5% of turnover or maximum of 40% of Value of fixed assets (VFA) for a maximum period 6 years
Zone 2- 2.5% of turnover or maximum of 35% of Value of fixed assets (VFA) for a maximum period 5 years
Zone 3- No Benefit for this Zone

2. Non - Monetary - Preferential Levy (Taxes/Penalties/Fees/Royalties)- Stamp Duty Exemption-
Zone 1 : 100%
Zone 2 : 100%
Zone 3 : No Benefit for this Zone

3. Non - Monetary - Preferential Levy (Taxes/Penalties/Fees/Royalties)- Concessional Registration Charges for MSMEs-
Zone 1, Zone 2: Concession of INR 1/- per INR 1,000/-
Zone 3 : No Benefit for this Zone

4. Non - Monetary - Preferential Levy (Taxes/Penalties/Fees/Royalties)-Exemption from Tax on Electricity Tariff for MSMEs
Zone 1 : 100% for 7 year
Zone 2 : 100% for 6 year
Zone 3 : No Benefit for this Zone

5. Non - Monetary - Preferential Levy (Taxes/Penalties/Fees/Royalties)- Land conversion fee for MSMEs
Zone 1 : 100% 
Zone 2 : 100%
Zone 3 : No Benefit for this Zone
data.how_to_apply: Applicant can register themselves on EBIZ- https://ebiz.karnataka.gov.in/kum/InvestorRegistrationForm.aspx
data.funding_facilitator: Commerce and Industries Department, Government of Karnataka
data.funding_mechanism: Amount will be disbursed to the beneficiary after approval of the application by the concerned authority.

data.checklist_info_a:
1. Common Application Form* 
2. Partnership deed / Articles of Association/byelaws 
3. Self-attested Project Report 
4. Udyam Registration Certificate /Industrial Entrepreneur Memorandum (IEM)/Industrial License (IL)  
5. Udyam Registration Certificate 
6. First Sale Invoice 
7. Lease deed of land (KIADB/KSSIDC/SEZ/FOOD PARK/KEONICS/CO-OP IND AREA/PVT. IND AREA) (if applicable) 
8. Loan release order 
9. Power sanction letter 
10. Power service letter 
11. Land conversion order issued by Revenue Department if applicable 
12. Layout map (Showing the land utilization in respect of individual enterprises) 
13. GST Registration Certificate (if applicable) 
14. ESI Registration Certificate (if applicable) 
15. EPF Registration Certificate (if applicable) 
16. Approved building plan or license obtained from competent authority 
17. Certificate from the Textile Department (for not availing any subsidy in respect of Textile based industries including Readymade Garment) 
18. Certified from Department of Agriculture/Horticulture for not availed subsidy in respect of Agro Food Processing Industry in any of the Government of Karnataka/India Schemes 
19. Statement of Fixed Assets in prescribed format in Annexure–5* 
20. Original Investment certificate format as in Annexure–6* 
21. Original Certificate from Civil Engineer/Architect in prescribed format in respect of investment made in building as in Annexure–7* 
22. Form of declaration regarding employment of local persons in the prescribed format as in Annexure–8* 
23. Original investment certificate from Chartered Accountant in prescribed format as in Annexure–9* in respect of small and medium enterprises 
24. Caste certificate 
25. Ex-service men certificate, if applicable
